statement: Trulicina gives you integers n, m, and k. It is guaranteed that k≥q 2 and n· m≡ 0 ±od{k}.Output a n by m grid of integers such that each of the following criteria hold: Each integer in the grid is between 1 and k, inclusive. Each integer from 1 to k appears an equal number of times. No two cells that share an edge have the same integer. It can be shown that such a grid always exists. If there are multiple solutions, output any.
input_specification: InputThe first line contains an integer t (1 ≤q t ≤q 10^4) — the number of test cases.The first line of each test case contains three integers n, m, and k (2 ≤q n· m≤q 2· 10^5, 2≤q k≤q n· m, n· m≡ 0 ±od{k}).It is guaranteed that the sum of n· m over all test cases does not exceed 2· 10^5.
output_specification: OutputFor each test case, output n lines, each containing m integers that satisfy the criteria. If there are multiple solutions, output any.
